00040 #ifndef _Camera_h
00041 #define _Camera_h
00042 
00043 #include "attachable.h"
00044 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00045 #include "datatypes.h"
00046 #include "quaternion.h"
00047 #include "ray.h"
00048 #include "vector3.h"
00049 
00050 namespace Ogre
00051 {
00052     class Camera;
00053 }
00054 
00055 namespace phys
00056 {
00057     class CameraManager;
00058     class World;
00059     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00060     /// @class Camera
00061     /// @headerfile camera.h
00062     /// @brief This is the camera class.
00063     /// @details This class contains all the functionality needed to manipulate an
00064     /// individual camera that has been created.
00065     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00066     class PHYS_LIB Camera : public Attachable
00067     {
00068         public:
00069             enum ProjectionType
00070             {
00071                 Orthographic,
00072                 Perspective
00073             };
00074         private:
00075             /// @internal
00076             /// @brief This is called by the called by the constructors, it is a single point of class initialization.
00077             /// @param Camera A pointer the graphics subsystem camera
00078             /// @param Manager The camera manager this wil
00079             void Construct(Ogre::Camera* Camera, CameraManager* Manager);
00080 
00081         protected:
00082             //needed mostly just for initialization of the world class when defaults are being made.
00083             friend class World;
00084             friend class Node;
00085             friend class CameraManager;
00086             /// @internal
00087             /// @brief This is the Camera used by the graphics Subsystem, that this class wraps
00088             Ogre::Camera* Cam;
00089 
00090             /// @internal
00091             /// @brief This is the Camera manager that this camera is attached to.
00092             CameraManager* CamManager;
00093 
00094         public:
00095             /// @brief Basic Camera Constructor.
00096             /// @details This is the basic constructor for the Camera class.
00097             Camera(const String& Name, CameraManager* Manager);
00098             /// @brief Ogre Cam Constructor.
00099             /// @details This is for internal use only and shouldn't be called manually.
00100             Camera(Ogre::Camera* Camera, CameraManager* Manager);
00101 
00102             /// @brief Class Destructor.
00103             /// @details The Class Destructor.
00104             virtual ~Camera();
00105 
00106             /// @brief Gets the camera's set name.
00107             /// @return Returns a string containing the camera's name.
00108             ConstString& GetName();
00109 
00110             /// @brief Sets the type of projection to be used with this camera.
00111             /// @details By default, all cameras are enabled with Perspective projection.  This is the standard 3-dimentional
00112             /// view anyone would expect in a 3D world.  Orthographic projection is useful when displaying 2D worlds, or only
00113             /// 2 dimentions of a 3D world.  It enables you to see the entire side of an object without regard for camera perspective.
00114             /// Perspective can be thought of as a pyramid, with the camera at the top of the cone.  Orthographic would instead be a
00115             /// cube.
00116             /// @param Type The type of projection to be used.
00117             void SetCameraType(ProjectionType Type);
00118             /// @brief Defines the size of the Orthographic projection window.
00119             /// @details This function will change the aspect ratio of the screen, determined by the values passed in.  To set the
00120             /// window size without changing the aspect ratio, call either the SetOrthoWindowHeight, or SetOrthoWindowWidth functions.
00121             /// @param Width The new width of the projection window.
00122             /// @param Height The new height of the projection window.
00123             void SetOrthoWindow(Real Width, Real Height);
00124             /// @brief Defines the size of the Orthographic projection window.
00125             /// @details This function will not change the aspect ratio of the screen, unlike SetOrthoWindow.  The aspect ratio will be
00126             /// preserved and the Width of the screen automatically recalculated based on the Height passed in.
00127             /// @param Height The new height of the projection window.
00128             void SetOrthoWindowHeight(Real Height);
00129             /// @brief Defines the size of the Orthographic projection window.
00130             /// @details This function will not change the aspect ratio of the screen, unlike SetOrthoWindow.  The aspect ratio will be
00131             /// preserved and the Height of the screen automatically recalculated based on the Width passed in.
00132             /// @param Width The new width of the projection window.
00133             void SetOrthoWindowWidth(Real Width);
00134             /// @brief Sets the location of a camera.
00135             /// @details Sets the location of the specified camera.
00136             /// @param Location The new location for the camera.
00137             void SetLocation(Vector3 Location);
00138             /// @brief Sets the Direction for the camera.
00139             /// @details Sets which axis the camera will look down for rendering.
00140             /// @param Direction The vector3 representing the axis to be used.
00141             void SetDirection(Vector3 Direction);
00142             /// @brief Sets the orientation of the camera.
00143             /// @details This function will set the orientation of the specified camera via a quaternion.
00144             /// @param Orientation The quaternion representing the new orientation.
00145             void SetOrientation(Quaternion Orientation);
00146             /// @brief Sets the short range clip distance.
00147             /// @details Sets the distance at which objects are considered too close to render.
00148             /// @param NearDist A Real representing the distance.  Note:  This number directly corolates to the dimentions
00149             /// you provide in the constructor for the physgame.  You should understand your games scale before setting
00150             /// this number.
00151             void SetNearClipDistance(Real NearDist);
00152             /// @brief Sets the long range clip distance.
00153             /// @details Sets the distance at which objects are considered too far to render.
00154             /// @param FarDist A Real representing the distance.  Note:  This number directly corolates to the dimentions
00155             /// you provide in the constructor for the physgame.  You should understand your games scale before setting
00156             /// this number.
00157             void SetFarClipDistance(Real FarDist);
00158             /// @brief Sets the aspect ratio of the cameras veiw.
00159             /// @details This function will set the aspect ratio between the width and height of the cameras viewing area.
00160             /// @param Ratio A Real that represents the aspect ratio, where Ratio = width / height.
00161             void SetAspectRatio(Real Ratio);
00162             /// @brief Sets the direction the camera faces.
00163             /// @details Sets the direction the camera faces.  Will also take orientation into account.
00164             /// @param TargetLoc The location in the game world to look at.
00165             void LookAt(Vector3 TargetLoc);
00166             /// @brief Sets whether to lock rotation around the Y axis.
00167             /// @details This function will lock rotations around the Y axis (or another axis if you specify).  This
00168             /// function is automatically called on by the camera constructor.
00169             /// @param UseFixed Enable or disable the locking of the axis.
00170             /// @param Axis The axis to lock, defaults to the Y axis.
00171             void SetFixedYawAxis(bool UseFixed, Vector3 Axis);
00172             /// @brief Sets whether to lock rotation around the Y axis.
00173             /// @details This function will lock rotations around the Y axis.  This function is automatically called
00174             /// on by the camera constructor.
00175             /// @param UseFixed Enable or disable the locking of the axis.
00176             void SetFixedYawAxis(bool UseFixed);
00177             /// @brief Enables or disables auto tracking for the camera.
00178             /// @details This function can enable auto tracking of a given node you have created.
00179             /// @param Enabled Bool value to enable or disable auto tracking for this camera.
00180             /// @param Target Name of the node to be tracked.
00181             /// @param Offset The offset of where the camera is to look from the target.  I.E. Always 5 units ahead, etc..
00182             //void SetAutoTracking(bool Enabled, String Target, Vector3 Offset);
00183             /// @brief Enables or disables auto tracking for the camera.
00184             /// @details This function can enable auto tracking of a given node you have created.
00185             /// @param Enabled Bool value to enable or disable auto tracking for this camera.
00186             /// @param Target Name of the node to be tracked.
00187             //void SetAutoTracking(bool Enabled, String Target);
00188             /// @brief Gets a Ray from the camera to the viewport.
00189             /// @details This will cast a ray from the camera to the viewport and return it.
00190             /// @param Screenx A Real representing the relative location on screen, on the x axis(0.0-1.0).
00191             /// @param Screeny A Real representing the relative location on screen, on the y axis(0.0-1.0).
00192             Ray GetCameraToViewportRay(Real Screenx, Real Screeny);
00193             /// @brief Gets the node attached to a camera.
00194             /// @details This will return a string that is the name of the node the specified camera is attached to if any.
00195             String GetNodeAttachedToCamera();
00196             /// @brief Gets the relative location of a camera.
00197             /// @details Gets the location of the camera, relative to any connected nodes, specified.
00198             Vector3 GetCameraRelativeLocation();
00199             /// @brief Gets the global location of a camera.
00200             /// @details Gets the real world location of the camera specified.
00201             Vector3 GetCameraGlobalLocation();
00202             /// @brief Will zoom in or out the camera.
00203             /// @details This function will zoom in the camera by the amount specified.
00204             /// @param Zoom A Real of how much to zoom in by.  Note:  This number directly corolates to the dimentions
00205             /// you provide in the constructor for the physgame.  You should understand your games scale before setting
00206             /// this number.
00207             void ZoomCamera(Real Zoom);
00208             /// @brief Resets the zoom level back to the default.
00209             /// @details This function will return the zoom level back to normal.  Note this function will only work if
00210             /// the camera is attached to a node.
00211             void ResetZoom();
00212     };
00213 }//phys
00214 
00215 #endif
